CyberSOC CTF Challenge

TheThe CyberSOC challenge is a quite interesting test of patience, perseverance, and the stock ability to think , The challenge claims a link is hidden in the provided image, a link to which the challenge will be started.

My initial thought was â€œSecurity by Obscurityâ€ which led me to believe certain information was hidden in the image either in metadata or hidden in bits of unused data of the image file.Â

Challenge 2

Challenge 3

if a flag is more than just cloth and ink, What else could it beÂ ?

Asked to crack a code and all we were given are flags, So most definitely we need text characters from the flags.

Seeing flags i immediately knew we were dealing with a alpha-2 codes

which are two-letter country codes defined as part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.

An example of alpha 2 code below

So substituting our flags for the alpah2code equivalent should give us our flag, but one solution leads to another problemÂ  How can we identify the nationality of the flags?, All i did was crop out each individual flag and did google reverse image search to figure out the Country the flag belonged to

Challenge 4

Well curiosity kills, most people would definitely click a link that says Donâ€™t click me which led me to be quite wary of what an executable with the name â€œrunâ€ doesÂ ,

Needed to be sure of the appâ€™s content and what it intends to do, so simple reverse engineering with the strings run.exe reveal a hidden flag. Easy rightÂ ?

Amnesty Decoders is a global network of digital volunteers, all using their computers or phone to help Amnestyâ€™s researchers sort through pictures, documents and information and track and expose human rights violations

Challenge 7

when the â€œgeolocationâ€ image was captured?

Metadata summarizes basic information about data, and stores that information in unused bits in the fileÂ 

ExifTool is a free and open-source software program for reading, writing, and manipulating image, audio, video, and PDF metadata

Challenge 8
